headline.print_headline: A Soda Fight Moves to a Sitcom Town
headline.main: A Soda Fight Moves to a Sitcom Town

docs.abstract: In what is surely the first dramatic adaptation of the mayor's ban on large sugary drinks, the sitcom "Parks and Recreation" took on the issue of a soda tax.
docs.snippet: In what is surely the first dramatic adaptation of the mayor's ban on large sugary drinks, the sitcom "Parks and Recreation" took on the issue of a soda tax.

docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column suggests schools focus more on the emotional basis of success;.highlights Paul Tough book How Children Succeed, which describes the ways in which childhood experiences affect adults' lives.
docs.lead_paragraph: There are strong links between our childhood experiences and adult lives. The emotional basis of success should have a bigger role in education.
docs.snippet: There are strong links between our childhood experiences and adult lives. The emotional basis of success should have a bigger role in education.

keywords.value: How Children Succeed: Grit, Curiosity, and the Hidden Power of Character (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

headline.seo: Doctors Reminded to Screen for Alcohol Problems
headline.print_headline: Doctors Reminded to Ask Patients About Alcohol Use
headline.main: Panel Reminds Doctors to Screen for Alcohol Misuse

docs.abstract: United States Preventive Services Task Force reaffirms that primary care doctors should screen their adult patients to determine whether they are misusing alcohol, and provide counseling when risky behavior is detected; reports that alcohol misuse results in an estimated 85,000 deaths a year, making it the third-leading cause of preventable death in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: A panel of medical experts reaffirmed a recommendation intended to direct patients with risky drinking behaviors into counseling.
docs.snippet: A panel of medical experts reaffirmed a recommendation intended to direct patients with risky drinking behaviors into counseling.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

headline.seo: In the Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health
headline.print_headline: In Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health
headline.main: In Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health

docs.abstract: Dozens of researchers participating in the Tsimane Health and Life History Project have been studying Bolivia's large indigenous Tsimane group since 2002, hoping to tease out insights into the medical conditions that plague modernized societies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers have been studying the Tsimane, the largest indigenous group in the Amazon still living in traditional ways, to tease out insights into diseases ailing modernized societies.
docs.snippet: Researchers have been studying the Tsimane, the largest indigenous group in the Amazon still living in traditional ways, to tease out insights into diseases ailing modernized societies.

headline.print_headline: Patterns: BPA Levels Tied to Obesity in Youths
headline.main: BPA Levels Tied to Obesity in Youths

docs.abstract: A study has found that the risk of obesity is higher among children with high urinary levels of the chemical, which is widely used in food packaging.
docs.snippet: A study has found that the risk of obesity is higher among children with high urinary levels of the chemical, which is widely used in food packaging.

headline.print_headline: Avoiding Sugared Drinks Limits Weight Gain in Two Studies
headline.main: Avoiding Sugared Drinks Limits Weight Gain in Two Studies

docs.abstract: Two randomized clinical trials published in The New England Journal of Medicine lend credence to the idea that limiting access to sugary drinks may help reduce obesity; findings give advocates of New York City's ban on large sweetened beverages a potent weapon.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City’s ban on large sweetened beverages has been hotly disputed, but these clinical trials show that replacing sugary drinks can slow weight gain in children.
docs.snippet: New York City’s ban on large sweetened beverages has been hotly disputed, but these clinical trials show that replacing sugary drinks can slow weight gain in children.
